guide_quality: the tour guide was unprofessional, they couldn’t even give as little as water and when we came back to complain to mr timothy, he became extremely rude and hostile

our guide for the day, ebrima, was outstanding, highly professional, and led us through the maze of crowded border checks and ferry crossings with maximum efficiency and minimal stress
cultural_value: we saw all the highlights (the chimpanzees were particularly special)
when we arrived at the forest we were met by our local guide, i believe his name was modi
we took a small boat along the river and saw the oyster beds & locals that harvested and sorted them
value_pricing: trips are much cheaper than trips organized by polish travel agencies – and during the trip with timotours tourists are supplied with unlimited water (it is very important during hot sunny days in the gambia) and had the opportunity to eat local meals (all included in trip price)
the excursions are superbly organized, and compared to other travel agencies, they're not overpriced
prices are very reasonable and were adequately fed and watered throughout
safety_security: booked 3 trips, fathala, roots village, and 6 in 1,  all excellent experiences, our guide ebrima was fab, very knowledgeable and had a great sense of humour, felt very safe when out and about

general_improvements: (It needs a tune-up every few kilometers) It really needs improvement for such a distance

historical_significance: simon is a wonderful storyteller and shows us a wealth of gambia

guide_quality: simon is very friendly and helpful, and the excursions with him are affordable and well-organized
friendly service and the time to visit and explore everything at our own pace
simon takes us on a calm and friendly tour and guided us
cultural_value: we visited the main sights, but also a visit to a local hospital, local villages, and families, where we gave the children clothes, school supplies, and candy
authentic african cuisine prepared under "gambian" conditions; a delightful experience
both saidou (simon) and dembo were amazing especially getting us back safely from senegal which will remain etched in the memory forever
ferry_service: it went very smoothly, and simon sent us extra photos of the boats, which reassured our daughter
besides these "standard" trips, we asked him if it was possible to go inland and distribute various goods to people who truly have nothing
we chose simon from the netherlands because of the good reviews on tripadvisor
accessibility_comfort: he responds quickly to emails and whatsapp messages, is a great resource, and easy to talk to
which isn't easy by african standards, but he works with tourists, so he understands
especially after the three difficult years of covid-19, during which they received no financial support from the government, they deserve it more than ever
value_pricing: the trips you can book through your travel agency are more expensive, and sometimes you're crammed into a truck with 15 people
simon's tour was completely tailored to our needs, with stops at some truly surprising locations, excellent food, and affordable prices
this trip was £10 cheaper than thomas cook's and tailored to the size of our group
safety_security: simon kept a close eye on everything, and we felt safe and secure during the activities
both saidou (simon) and dembo were amazing especially getting us back safely from senegal which will remain etched in the memory forever
his drivers are also reliable and safety comes first

cultural_value: age also helped us with other requests as visiting a local market for buying some spices and so on

historical_significance: communications and planning before the trip were excellent, logistics were smoothly dealt with throughout (importantly rapidly switching vehicles via foday's extensive local network when we had a leaking radiator to ensure the birding schedule was uninterrupted), and he is simply an amazing birder who (unlike many guides in gambia) is genuinely passionate about birding as a hobby rather than just a job

car rental price was reasonable in compare to other car rentals

historical_significance: each stop introduces you to a local area and in guinea bissau you are entertained by a wonderful group of ladies - you can even join the traditional dancing if you like
our first destination was the stone circles in wassu (a unesco world heritage site), with a small but beautifully designed exhibition and clean restrooms
the 4wd was with lams himself who is a wonderful guide and explained about the flora and fauna; history and politics and culture
guide_quality: the motorbike part of the tour in guinea bissau was also a great idea since the roads are in poor condition and the distance isn't far
lams and his colleague bax were extremely friendly and informative
i also took a return airport transfer which lams organized and smiley was a great lad too - friendly, safe, punctual and welcoming
cultural_value: in just a few short days we explored three countries - the gambia, senegal and guinea-bissau, all amazing unique countries with wonderful scenery, food, people, wildlife, culture, and lams and his team got me much closer to all of this than i ever could have done on my own

highlights included seeing wild chimpanzees and hippos, tasting wonderful street food, seeing how people authentically live, and all the memorable interactions i had with the amazing people of west africa
many thanks especially to lams, baks and musa especially for making this trip one that i will always remember and keep close to my heart
ferry_service: the tour was simply amazing and well organised, with lams ensuring everything went smoothly at every step of the journey
bacary or lams were at my side at all border crossings which made the whole process very smooth
communication while i was planning the trip was very good
infrastructure_state: the motorbike part of the tour in guinea bissau was also a great idea since the roads are in poor condition and the distance isn't far
the complex is not in good condition, but that was easily rectified by the fort's curator, who told us so many interesting facts that it was a joy

accessibility_comfort: he made the logistics very easy and did a great job
he is also very nice and easy going

value_pricing: we didn't spend that much time in guinea-bissau itself, but the trip was nevertheless well worth it, as both lams and bax are truly kind and hospitable guides with a lot of knowledge that they shared with us
the cost was definitely not worth such a short time at the circles
this tour was ideal in every way—the plan, the a/c vehicle, the safe driver, the experience of the guides, the sights we saw, the understanding we gained, and the reasonable price
safety_security: i also took a return airport transfer which lams organized and smiley was a great lad too - friendly, safe, punctual and welcoming
border crossings are smooth, everything is well organized and safe
if you want a legitimate, "authentic" experience in a new country/countries while still feeling comfortable and safe, lams is perfect

Very professional, knowledgeable,reliable and good value for money does a good variety of trips will tailor make them to your needs, if you choose to use him you will not be disappointed

historical_significance: amazing experience with sophie in her beautiful home, shopping, cooking and eating traditional gambian food
it was amazing we saw a traditional gambian compound, went to the market to buy fresh food and fish then we returned to the compound to cook two complete meals that would feed 30 people

cultural_value: ________________________________________ 2) fathala wildlife reserve: game viewing, walking with lions, and the roots tour everyone was thrilled with the game drive and the unique opportunity to walk with lions – a truly exhilarating experience

i cannot recommend black and white safari highly enough �� thank you for making our adventure so special
ferry_service: we knew what we wanted to do as we had done some trips 12 years earlier we decided to do fatala with walk with lions this is fantastic a good day out lots of memories ,lamin our tour guide was fantastic on the tour looked after us going through seagal boarder which is a bit mad now
if you book with b&w safari, you will get good service and will feel safe

for the 2nd trip we did the four wheel drive which again was a fantastic day we visited the crocodile park and stroked the crocodiles, we visited the markets which was good to see but it was definitely an eye opener, we hosted a school where the children were so happy and in their classes they demonstrated what theyve learned, we also visited the wood carving factory which was ok but it wasn't really a factory it was more just a wood carving market really and every stall holder had carved the same thing, from there we went onto paradise beach for some lunch and a little relax time, the 2 of us and the other couple that were with us weren't interested in the fish factory which was to follow the paradise beach so therefore they gave us more time at the beach armstrong and his team are lovely people very knowledgeable and helpful i would highly recommend these trips and definitely through this company
accessibility_comfort: the care, patience, and knowledge shown by the guides made every moment enriching, accessible, and deeply memorable
________________________________________ final thoughts: every single excursion was made accessible and enjoyable, even for guests with mobility challenges
arms made everything so easy when booking
value_pricing: ________________________________________ 3) wild chimpanzee experience at baboon island this was a long day with about 10 hours of driving, but absolutely worth it
a big thank you to our drivers and tour guides on the safari across to senegal, the whole day is a great experience and even though we did not do the lion walk it was still so worth it

by email the boss told me that the visit to fathala was worth it in the end too much vegetation so no animals were seen except 3 giraffes 5 zebras and 3 small warthogs for 6 hours round trip it's expensive to pay the boss didn't even offer a partial refund
safety_security: your safety and comfort is paramount to them
i was alone with my daughter and felt safe and well looked after from start to finish
we instantly felt safe and welcomed

general_improvements: I can go on and we have never been let down
We booked three tours with B & W, the safari with lion walk, the four wheel drive, and the lazy day fishing and were not disappointed
The tours were reasonably priced and  we were not disappointed
Post lion walk we did the safari not bad but does t compare to the big safaris I've been lucky enough to do in Kenya but for first timers you won't be disappointed
The park itself is a bit disappointing
Me and my Girlfriend visited Gambia for the first time last week and through recommendation from a friend decided to book 2 tours with Black and White and we we're not disappointed
We were not disappointed, we had a couple of questions about their web site and the owner Armstrong sent us his whats app number and we conversed a few times before booking
I think he was slightly disappointed that we did not wish to arrange further excursions (our hotel had its own taxi driver on call so we were sorted for all the local trips we wanted to take)
I think if anyone is disappointed with a tour then this is down to some unreal expectations they had as the company is always honest, realistic and truthful
everyone i spoke to was disappointed that booked with the holiday rep and wished they had booked our one
Another thing is that our driver on that trip was not good

Don't hesitate to book your trips with B&W, you will never be disappointed - all the guides are very well trained, very informative and helpful, caring and looking after you, making everything for you to have a memorable, safe, fantastic and unforgettable holiday

guide_quality: omar was very friendly and had a lot to share, and we could also ask him anything
a reliable and knowledgeable guide who truly cares about delivering a quality experience
omi was kind, friendly, interesting, helpful, reliable and honest
cultural_value: one advantage of a tour with omar compared to one with, for example, tui, is that it's much more authentic, and there are more options if you want to see more
we had a brilliant adventure, with some interesting characters along the journey, tried some local food, and got to experience things we would never have back home in england

the game drive was lots of fun with our entertaining guide, lamin and omi also allowed us to experience a delicious lunch of local gambian food, as well as enabling us to greet many local children to the sounds of 'hello toubab'
ferry_service: he organized everything - picking us up from our hotel in kotu, helping us navigate the river crossing by wooden boat (as the ferry was out of action), providing drinks and delicious omelettes for breakfast and helping us through the border crossings quickly and efficiently
omi tours are so good because they are personal tours and omi and his driver really looked after us and we always felt safe i can thoroughly recommend them and this trip out of ten
overall a very good trip and i would suggest to anyone to reach out before their trip to the gambia to organise a trip with him
accessibility_comfort: he made sure we were comfortable, well-informed and able to make the most out of our short time
omar is such a jolly and easy-going person, and gave us a really good insight into the history and life in the gambia
at the senegalese border, we switched from car to a less comfortable shared taxi
safety_security: omi is a responsive communicator, we felt physically safe with our guide, kumuna (who was cheerful and did his best), the vehicle they put us in never broke down, the driver was responsible, and all were very knowledgable about the gambia
it'd be possible to do the trip yourself on public transport but, for us, traveling with omar was a great decision, as we felt safe and confident in his skills
at the border crossing he just pointed us where to go and waited for us and straight back in the jeep so everything was quick and easy most importantly, we felt safe as long as he was in sight

guide_quality: our friendly and helpful guide (kit) was very informative and organized everything perfectly

historical_significance: what an absolutely brilliant lady walking history book she is i can't thank her enough for taking us to kunta kinta island i have read the book watched the program on tv nothing and i mean absolutely nothing compares about actually being there for real the museum had me in tears i was shocked at just what people went to throw heartbreaking but i am so so glad i went aji is such a wonderful lady her knowledge on everything was amazing the only lady touring guide in gambia and i won't go with anyone else i'm glad my boyfriend malang sanneh was with me my rock aji i can't thank you enough i will definitely be coming back and hopefully booking the 2 day tour anyone wanting to go on trips i very highly recommend aji tours xxxx
she is amazing person with great knowledge about her countyside, history and local usages
guide_quality: she is very friendly and everything was included, even drinks

with aji i experienced the trip of a lifetime in the lion walk- 
aji is a knowledgeable tour guide and goes out of her way to make sure you have the best experience
she's a determined, friendly, and positive gambian woman
cultural_value: she is amazing person with great knowledge about her countyside, history and local usages
booked this tour with ali, a local man
the food was delicious and traditionally prepared
ferry_service: aji is very good at what she does, and when i return to the gambia i'll use her services again

accessibility_comfort: he made us feel very comfortable and safe and we had an unforgettable day
her office is opposite boss lady restaurant in kotu and easy to find
value_pricing: what this little woman can't do, it's not worth being able to do 😍 after our trips, she sent the most beautiful pictures that she took of us on the trip - so at the same time as being our guide, she was also our photographer 🙏 she has our warmest recommendations - and she will be the first person we will contact when we (soon) go to gambia again

my favorite thing about aji was the fact she is empowering local women (and herself) to succeed in a male dominated industry and is working very hard to ensure every customer is satisfied at a fair price
safety_security: we heard from several locals that she's reliable and that we could safely book with her
he made us feel very comfortable and safe and we had an unforgettable day
we saw the real gambia in a 4x4 jeep with a skilled driver, where safety was paramount

quotes: what this little woman can't do, it's not worth being able to do 😍 after our trips, she sent the most beautiful pictures that she took of us on the trip - so at the same time as being our guide, she was also our photographer 🙏 she has our warmest recommendations - and she will be the first person we will contact when we (soon) go to gambia again

my favorite thing about aji was the fact she is empowering local women (and herself) to succeed in a male dominated industry and is working very hard to ensure every customer is satisfied at a fair price

historical_significance: our guide demba was just amazing, gave us a lot of information about history and living style of gambia
guide_quality: - punctual - well organized - helpful - friendly
they were, without exception, knowledgeable and engaging and could answer any questions we had
excellent local tour guides
cultural_value: i can only recommend ecotours, especially because the profits enable around 50 children to go to school, including uniforms, breakfast, and learning materials

he took care about us all the time, giving us fresh drinks and making us smile :) we had a great opportunity to see the chimpanzees and baboons on the river gambia, to meet and spend some time with the local people, take knowledge about the great gambian history of slavery

day 2 - breakfast, walking city tour of jangjanbureh, drive to rice fields for a walk and tour, visit local family in remote village, lunch, drive to tendaba camp for a few hours of relaxation (they have lovely accommodation and swimming pool), dinner and overnight stay
ferry_service: we had a trip together with demba who worked at ecoutours, he was a very good storyteller and knew many interessant places
particular highlights were the very warm welcome at the village community we visited, seeing a family of wild hippos on the boat trip and experiencing good local food for every meal
two very good and nice guides took us for a great trip
accessibility_comfort: despite the difficult nature of the roots tour (learning how the gambia and its people were impacted by the slave trade) we felt it was a very important part to visiting gambia and demba's local knowledge and charm made both trips enjoyable
guides on our boat trips for birding and chimpanzees were knowledgeable and easy to talk to
value_pricing: hats off to demba and amadou, they delivered a great trip for a reasonable price

historical_significance: you will see all the beautiful, cultural (real life) spots at your own pace
guide_quality: yaya's team consists of excellent drivers and guides
the service on both day trips was also excellent
we were also struck by the informative explanations we received about the sights and culture of gambia
cultural_value: santosu goes beyond simply showing us the attractions; they share extensive insights into local customs, which gives the excursions a deeper meaning
all in all, we highly recommend santosu to anyone looking for a unique and personalized excursion experience
the great thing is that the money doesn't go into the pockets of the big companies, but truly benefits the locals
accessibility_comfort: participants are well looked after during the excursions, including plenty of drinks to ensure everyone stays comfortable and hydrated
value_pricing: they have all the necessary documentation and will show you the real gambia, and they're also cheaper
safety_security: we also felt it was important that max drove very safely
we felt very safe during all our trips
so you're in safe hands
